trending.name: bit64
trending.title: A S3 Class for Vectors of 64bit Integers
trending.description:
Package 'bit64' provides serializable S3 atomic 64bit
(signed) integers. These are useful for handling database keys
and exact counting in +-2^63. WARNING: do not use them as
replacement for 32bit int

trending.title: Import and Export 'SPSS', 'Stata' and 'SAS' Files
trending.description:
Import foreign statistical formats into R via the embedded
'ReadStat' C library, <https://github.com/WizardMac/ReadStat>.

command, using either base graphics or 'ggplot2' graphics.

new.name: rfastlowess
new.title: High-performance LOWESS smoothing for `Rust`, `Python`, and `R`
new.description:
Provides high-performance LOWESS smoothing (Locally
Weighted Scatterplot Smoothing) using a 'Rust' backend.
Supports various weight functions, robustness iterations,
streaming/online processing, cross

new.name: yardstick
new.title: Tidy Characterizations of Model Performance
new.description:
Tidy tools for quantifying how well model fits to a data
set such as confusion matrices, class probability curve
summaries, and regression metrics (e.g., RMSE).

new.name: tEDM
new.title: Temporal Empirical Dynamic Modeling
new.description:
Inferring causation from time series data through
empirical dynamic modeling (EDM), with methods such as
convergent cross mapping from Sugihara et al. (2012)
<doi:10.1126/science.1227079>, partial cro

new.name: clockify
new.title: A Wrapper for the 'Clockify' API
new.description:
A wrapper for the Clockify API
<https://docs.clockify.me/>, making it possible to query,
insert and update time keeping data.

new.name: Rblpapi
new.title: R Interface to 'Bloomberg'
new.description:
An R Interface to 'Bloomberg' is provided via the 'Blp
API'.

new.name: occumb
new.title: Site Occupancy Modeling for Environmental DNA Metabarcoding
new.description:
Fits community site occupancy models to environmental DNA
metabarcoding data collected using spatially-replicated survey
design. Model fitting results can be used to evaluate and
compare the effective

new.name: midr
new.title:
Learning from Black-Box Models by Maximum Interpretation
Decomposition

for interpreting and explaining black-box predictive models by
creating a globally interpretable surrogate model. The package
